metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1285 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
named in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.8-P4 and 9.10.x before 9.10.3-P4 does notproperly handle DNAME records when parsing fetch reply messages, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure anddaemon exit) via a malformed packet to the rndc (aka control channel)interface, related to alist.c and sexpr.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libbind9-90 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libdns-export100 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libdns100 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libirs-export91 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libisc-export95 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libisc95 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libisccc90 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libisccfg-export90 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
libisccfg90 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
liblwres90 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-1').
